bwwExcerpt: Last winter, fortunate theatergoers fell madly, hopelessly in love with 'Brief Encounter,' the enchanting British spin on the Noel Coward movie that had a limited sold-out run at the adventurous little St. Ann's Warehouse under the Brooklyn Bridge. As it turns out, our brief affair was not hopeless after all. The Roundabout Theatre Company has swept up the ingenious import and put it on Broadway...
